source.2bbd9767: ** What is the name of highest paid person (including benefits)?**

source.9cd996b8: ** Check the head of the DataFrame. **
source.1f83cbab: ** What is the name of lowest paid person (including benefits)? Do you notice something strange about how much he or she is paid?**
source.520e3248: ** Bonus: Is there a correlation between length of the Job Title string and Salary? **
source.824c1bb1: ** What is the job title of  JOSEPH DRISCOLL ? Note: Use all caps, otherwise you may get an answer that doesn't match up (there is also a lowercase Joseph Driscoll). **
source.1574a694: ** How many Job Titles were represented by only one person in 2013? (e.g. Job Titles with only one occurence in 2013?) **
source.aa873d84: ** What are the top 5 most common jobs? **
source.615dbd80: ** What is the highest amount of OvertimePay in the dataset ? **
source.0419fe1e:
# SF Salaries Exercise 

Welcome to a quick exercise for you to practice your pandas skills! We will be using the [SF Salaries Dataset](https://www.kaggle.com/kaggle/sf-salaries) from Kaggle! Just follow along and complete the tasks outlined in bold below. The tasks will get harder and harder as you go along.
source.be5b9593: ** How many people have the word Chief in their job title? (This is pretty tricky) **
source.beef31c7: ** How much does JOSEPH DRISCOLL make (including benefits)? **
source.bf1987fa: ** Use the .info() method to find out how many entries there are.**
